title: Market Basket launches its own beer — here’s where to buy it
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Market Basket has launched a 'More For Your Dollar' lager in partnership with Vermont's Zero Gravity Beer.
The 12-pack, priced at $12.99, is available in Massachusetts, Maine, and New Hampshire Market Basket locations.
The launch follows recent company leadership changes with the ousting of CEO Arthur T. Demoulas.

title: As SJC mulls involvement in public defender work stoppage, here’s where things stand
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts public defenders initiated a work stoppage in May seeking higher hourly pay, leading to a legal crisis.
State lawmakers approved a 30% hourly pay increase for court-appointed attorneys, slightly alleviating representation shortages.
The Supreme Judicial Court is considering involvement to resolve the crisis while maintaining separation of powers limits.

title: Reese Witherspoon visits Boston bookstore
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Reese Witherspoon visited Beacon Hill Books and Cafe in Boston for a private dinner and book signing on Wednesday.
Witherspoon signed her debut novel 'Gone Before Goodbye,' a bestseller co-authored with Harlan Coben, while visiting Boston.
She attended Harvard Business School for a case discussion and reflected on her movie 'Legally Blonde's' connection to Harvard.

title: GOP lawmakers pushing Healey for info on aide arrested in cocaine bust
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Republican lawmakers are questioning Governor Maura Healey's vetting process after aide LaMar Cook's cocaine trafficking arrest.
Cook, a former Springfield-based aide, was fired following his arrest and had previous criminal charges from a 2001 incident.
GOP candidates in the 2026 gubernatorial race are urging an independent investigation into Healey's hiring procedures.

title: 2 teens killed in New Bedford crash identified
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Two teens, Gabriel Bertolino Siqueira, 17, and Anne Urbanski Santos De Carvalho, 15, were killed in a New Bedford car crash.
The crash occurred on Route 140 South; a 2019 Honda Civic was found off-road with significant damage.
The driver, an 18-year-old from Dartmouth, sustained non-life-threatening injuries; the crash investigation is ongoing.

title: BPD releases multiple photos of baseball-capped commercial burglary suspect
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police are seeking help identifying a suspect in downtown commercial burglaries starting on August 21.
The suspect has stolen credit cards, cash, and electronics from businesses; police released photos for identification.
Similar incidents reported by Boston University, Cambridge, and Northeastern University police include break-ins and thefts.

title: Report: Mike Vrabel’s former team was ‘unwilling’ to trade with Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tennessee Titans reportedly unwilling to trade with New England Patriots due to past tensions with coach Mike Vrabel.
Titans' owner Amy Adams Strunk is reportedly influenced by Vrabel's previous firing and friction with the organization.
Patriots made trade inquiries but ultimately stood pat at the deadline; Titans have since struggled this season.

title: Following a career night, Josh Minott isn’t taking his starting role for granted
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Josh Minott scored a career-high 21 points in the Celtics' 136-107 win against the Washington Wizards.
Minott, previously averaging 2.3 points per game with the Timberwolves, signed a two-year contract with the Celtics.
Teammate Jaylen Brown praised Minott's energy and defense, marking him as a key contributor to the team.

title: Are the New England Patriots back? Here’s what 200 readers said.
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Readers split on Patriots' success: 43% say 'Yes!', 44% say 'Too early', and 13% express skepticism.
Quarterback Drake Maye and coach Mike Vrabel praised for leading Patriots' six-game winning streak.
Critics note Patriots' favorable schedule, questioning if they've faced a strong opponent yet.

title: Questions swirl after bus aide allegedly assaults autistic student from Cambridge
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: An alleged assault on a 9-year-old autistic student by a bus aide was captured on video, leading to an investigation.
The Cambridge school district and NRT Bus Co. launched investigations, placing the aide on leave and filing reports with DCF.
The student's family removed him from bus services after the incident, prioritizing his safety by personally driving him to school.
